law.catch_line: Responsibilities of hospital after receipt of notice of intent to leave.

text.section: An authorized staff physician of the hospital shall discharge the child from the hospital within five (5) days, exclusive of holidays and weekends, after receipt of a child's notice of intent to leave, unless the hospital, the parent, or other person exercising custodial control or supervision files a notice of contest with the court within the five (5) day period.

Copies of the notice of contest shall be delivered by the party originating it to:
The child or his attorney;
The child's parent or other person exercising custodial control or supervision; and
The hospital.
The proponent of continued hospitalization shall file a petition for certification with his notice of contest.

law.history: Created 1986 Ky. Acts ch. 423, sec. 165, effective July 1, 1987.
